brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study was to determine whether high carboxyhemoglobin level is a risk
      factor for postoperative adverse events in children exposured to carbon monoxide, especially
      enviromental tobacco smoke.

clinical_study.brief_title: COMPLICATIONS RELATED CARBOXYHEMOGLOBIN LEVELS IN SECOND HAND SMOKING PEDIATRIC TONSILLECTOMY PATIENTS

detailed_description.textblock: Also we want to measure bleeding volume and compare it with the carboxyhemoglobin levels.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        -Patients 1-12 years old scheduled for adenotonsillectomy; written informed consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Active smokers, history of prematurity, bleeding disorders, hemolysis, severe
             pulmonary disease, home oxygen use, and inpatient hospitalisation≥24 h.

study_pop.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        -Patients 1-12 years old scheduled for adenotonsillectomy; written informed consent.

clinical_study.official_title: COMPLICATIONS OF SECOND HAND SMOKING IN PEDIATRIC TONSILLECTOMY PATIENTS

other_outcome.description: Does second hand smoking affects pain?
other_outcome.measure: Correlation between carboxyhemoglobin levels and pain of the second hand smoking children

primary_outcome.measure: Correlatin between carboxyhemoglobib levels of the second hand smoking children and postoperative complications and pain

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

results_reference.citation: Skolnick ET, Vomvolakis MA, Buck KA, Mannino SF, Sun LS. Exposure to environmental tobacco smoke and the risk of adverse respiratory events in children receiving general anesthesia. Anesthesiology. 1998 May;88(5):1144-53.

Koop CE. Adverse anesthesia events in children exposed to environmental tobacco smoke: exposure to environmental tobacco smoke and the risk of adverse respiratory events in children receiving general anesthesia. Anesthesiology. 1998 May;88(5):1141-2.

secondary_outcome.description: Any relation between carboxyhemoglobin and bleeding?
secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between carboxyhemoglobin levels of the second hand smoking children and intraoperative bleeding volume

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
